title: How to Know If Your Gmail Has Been Hacked (& Secure Your Account)

steps.title: Log into your Gmail account.
steps.content: Log into your Gmail account. Passwords are case-sensitive. Typing “password” isn’t the same as typing “PASSWORD”.

steps.title: Click your avatar.
steps.content: Click your avatar. It's located in the upper right corner of your browser.

steps.title: Click “Device activity & notifications”.
steps.content: Click “Device activity & notifications”. It's located in the sidebar on the left.

steps.title: Click “Review events” under “Recent security events”.
steps.content: Click “Review events” under “Recent security events”. Here, you'll be able to see any sign-in activity in the past 28 days.

steps.title: Go back.
steps.content: Go back. Click the back button (left arrow) in the top left corner of your browser next to the URL address bar.

steps.title: Secure your account.
steps.content: Secure your account. If you see any strange sign-in activity or devices you don't recognize, click “Secure your account” at the top of the page.

steps.title: Click on your avatar.
steps.content: Click on your avatar. It's in the upper right hand corner of your browser.

steps.title: You will be signed out of all devices that currently has access to your email.
steps.content: You will be signed out of all devices that currently has access to your email.

steps.title: Log into your account again using the new password.
steps.content: Log into your account again using the new password.
